page.title: 05Housing in New Thundersley
page.content: There are considerable contrasts in the types and distribution of the { {housing }in the area. Around the two commons there are a number of large two-storeyed houses built around the First World War and between the wars - rendered, and with tiles made in the local{brickfield}now closed down.(It was next to the Little Common).Other houses on the clay land are, first, {plotland-bungalow,} these are dispersed, small, and originally built of very flimsy material - asbestos, hardboard, with a pebble - dash exterior. Second there are many new housing {estates }in the south of the area; these display the irregular cul - de - sac form common to the modern housing patterns of chalet development.
